features: Same product, new look, nine 90-count packs of Sensitive baby wipes. This product is identical in manufacturing and formulation to the previous 720 count
Packaging is transitioning and may vary from pictures
Gentle enough for delicate skin; no harsh irritants
Free from: Fragrances, alcohol, bronopol, dyes, parabens and phthalates
For use on face, hands and bottom
Dispose of used wipes in trash receptacle; DO NOT FLUSH
Packaging made with at least 25% Post Consumer Recycled Material
body.description: Amazon Elements Sensitive wipes are made with pharmaceutical-grade purified water, aloe and vitamin E for clean and gentle wipes. Each one is strong, soft, large, and textured for cleaning hands, face, and diaper area. Your order includes nine flip-top packs for on the go.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: How are the wipes determined as being safe for my baby? Amazon Elements baby wipes have passed robust clinical testing, supervised by a dermatologist and pediatrician. Is this product different from the discontinued 810-count Amazon Elements Baby Wipes? Yes it is. A manufacturing defect caused accelerated oxidation and discoloration in our now-discontinued 810-count wipes. This defect does not affect our 720-count packages, which have been rigorously tested to meet our quality and safety standards. Can I use these baby wipes to clean other parts of my baby? Yes. Amazon Elements Baby Wipes are safe for cleaning your baby's hands, feet, face, and diaper area. Baby wipes should not be used to clean inside your baby's mouth, nose, ears, or eyes. What ingredients do you keep out of your baby wipes? Amazon Elements Baby Wipes do not contain dyes, parabens, phthalates, or alcohol. Can I rehydrate baby wipes that have dried out? Unfortunately, no. Our baby wipes are manufactured using pharmaceutical-grade purified water to keep them clean and effective; adding tap or bottled water might cause discoloration, odor, or even unwanted growths on the wipes.

Can I still use these if they’ve been left in a hot car? Being left in a hot car can cause wipes to dry out more quickly, especially if the lid isn't properly closed. However, the product will still be safe to use. How long do these baby wipes last? The recommended shelf life of Amazon Elements Baby Wipes is two years.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!
reviews.reviewText: I went to stay with a relative who had ..no running water and was constantly in need of wipes that clean hands and face and toothbrush after brushing. And these AMAZINGLY.. did that. I did a little test and used them to clean my utensils after eating a chicken and mashed potatos with butter dinner and... SURPRISINGLY... I felt the utensils after i dried them ..and ... no grease.. They looked cleanIm impressed!Amazon Elements Baby Wipes. Amazon Baby Wipes are truly a gamechangerThese wipes are like the Navy Seals of clean-ups. They work silently, efficiently, and leave no mess behind – well, except for the dirty diaper they just conquered.Firstly, the fragrance-free quality is a game-changer. It's like wiping your baby's bottom with a gentle whisper instead of a perfume factory explosion. No questionable scents, just pure, unscented victory.The value is straight-up absurd. I'm convinced Amazon is doing some kind of magic behind the scenes. Nine flip-top packs for on-the-go chaos control? It's like they know we're about to face diaper emergencies on a grand scale.These wipes are like the superhero sidekicks of cleanliness. Made with pharmaceutical-grade purified water, aloe, and vitamin E – it's like they have a secret formula for wiping out messes and leaving behind soft, happy babies.The texture is legit. It's not your average wipe; it's a cleaning powerhouse. Soft yet sturdy, large enough to tackle Godzilla-sized messes, and textured for that extra oomph. They clean hands, faces, and diaper areas like they're on a mission – which, let's be honest, they are.So, to all the parents out there – Amazon Elements Baby Wipes. Because sometimes life stinks, but your baby's bottom doesn't have t

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazon Elements Baby Wipes: The MVPs in Diaper Demolition
reviews.reviewText: Let's talk about the unsung heroes of parenthood – Amazon Elements Baby Wipes. These wipes are like the Navy Seals of clean-ups. They work silently, efficiently, and leave no mess behind – well, except for the dirty diaper they just conquered.Firstly, the fragrance-free quality is a game-changer. It's like wiping your baby's bottom with a gentle whisper instead of a perfume factory explosion. No questionable scents, just pure, unscented victory.The value is straight-up absurd. I'm convinced Amazon is doing some kind of magic behind the scenes. Nine flip-top packs for on-the-go chaos control? It's like they know we're about to face diaper emergencies on a grand scale.These wipes are like the superhero sidekicks of cleanliness. Made with pharmaceutical-grade purified water, aloe, and vitamin E – it's like they have a secret formula for wiping out messes and leaving behind soft, happy babies.The texture is legit. It's not your average wipe; it's a cleaning powerhouse. Soft yet sturdy, large enough to tackle Godzilla-sized messes, and textured for that extra oomph. They clean hands, faces, and diaper areas like they're on a mission – which, let's be honest, they are.So, to all the parents out there – Amazon Elements Baby Wipes. Because sometimes life stinks, but your baby's bottom doesn't have to.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely My Go To Wipes
reviews.reviewText: I can't say enough good things about Amazon Elements Baby Wipes! These wipes have become a lifesaver for me as a parent. They are gentle on my baby's sensitive skin and have a pleasant, mild scent. The thickness and durability of the wipes make cleanups a breeze, and they don't tear easily.I've tried other brands, but these wipes stand out in terms of quality and value. They're a staple in our diaper bag, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Amazon Elements Baby Wipes to fellow parents. A reliable and affordable choice!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewText: These to me are comparable to a name brand wipe such as huggies or pampers, but more value for the money. These are soft, the scent ones smell nice, and they also have no scent ones. They look high quality and feel high quality. My kids still use them even though they're potty trained (for when they do a #2). They're good sized and very easy to use. I never worry about my kids making a mess when cleaning themselves. I would highly recommend these over any other brand honestly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great Price for the number of packs…..
reviews.reviewText: I purchased these mainly for the great price with how many wipes there are and the fact that it’s got 4.7 stars. Right now we are having to stretch our dollar and this seemed like the good option. We generally purchase the pampers sensitive wipes because they don’t irritate my kiddo and they are wet enough to clean up messes without needing so many wipes. These, however, they are:- thick/ durable without the perfumes and additives = don’t rip easily-size of wipes fit my hand well for easy wiping- you can’t see through them ,so they are thick* my only complaint is that they aren’t wet enough to clean up yucky full diapers and require more wipes than necessary because there isn’t enough moisture in them. *

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A great cost for the amount of wipes received. Soft, moist, and scent-free. Hold up well when wiping up messes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I usually buy Berkeley & Jensen baby wipes (BJ’s) when shopping but it’s a pain to lug them home. Anyway, gave the Amazon brand my 1st try since it was a Today’s Deal- and am dry satisfied w/the size, softness and it’s a decent quality wipe. Not flimsy see thru or easily readable- like a dollar store brand could be, nor overly scented. Will probably repurchase w/ subscribe & save price point. Recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfectly soaked and not scented
reviews.reviewText: I usually buy name brands but decided to give these a try and I honestly like them. You get more product for less price. I really looks they are not overly soaked. They don’t tear easily great quality
These are good wipes , however I would have like them to be a bit more moist.
I really like these wipes and the price is good.Thicker than a store brand, which is nice. And They dont bother my babys butt like some other brands.I reccomand.

I love these for the price. Smaller in size that a regular pampers or Costco brand wipe and it's not as thick but I dont mind. If i need them to be more moist I add a bit of water into the wipe pack and that keeps them more moist. Overall will probably be purchasing again for the price and convenience.

reviews.reviewTitle: Very sensitive and a fantastic buy.
